body:
running tctl with `adm  namespace list` on a newly local build of temporal

## Actual Behavior

```                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             NAMESPACE                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              | ISGLOBALNAMESPACE | NOTIFICATIONVERSION  
  &NamespaceDetail{Info:&NamespaceInfo{Id:32049b68-7872-4094-8e63-d0dd59896a83,State:Registered,Name:temporal-system,Description:Temporal internal system                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             | false             |                   0  
  namespace,Owner:temporal-core@temporal.io,Data:map[string]string{},},Config:&NamespaceConfig{Retention:168h0m0s,ArchivalBucket:,BadBinaries:&v11.BadBinaries{Binaries:map[string]*BadBinaryInfo{},},HistoryArchivalState:Disabled,HistoryArchivalUri:,VisibilityArchivalState:Disabled,VisibilityArchivalUri:,},ReplicationConfig:&NamespaceReplicationConfig{ActiveClusterName:active,Clusters:[active],},ConfigVersion:0,FailoverNotificationVersion:-1,FailoverVersion:0,FailoverEndTime:<nil>,} |   
```
## Expected Behavior

The output should be outputting correct value and not golang object reference

## Specifications
- Version: master branch
- Platform:  Linux

comments.body:
@feedmeapples Looked inside the code and here are some analysis.

Currently the `tctl` support json and table format and the json format is just marshaling the whole value of `persistence.GetNamespaceResponse` in the `prettyPrintJSONObject` function. 

The issue in this ticket is referring to the `printTable` function which is currently printing out the elem of the struct. Looks like the current code at the moment want to print out 

```
 NAMESPACE | ISGLOBALNAMESPACE | NOTIFICATIONVERSION 
```
the question which field from the struct  `persistence.GetNamespaceResponse` in particular the `persistence.NamespaceDetail`  do we want to print out for the `NAMESPACE`  column to make it useful ?

right

there is a work going on currently in private repo that changes the printing of fields. Going to open the repo soon and show how this was addressed

You are right about CONTRIBUTING.md, it didn't explain how to find what is actually being addressed/changed. I'm going to take care of this, thx.

As a quick reply before contributing.md is updated:

Generally these issues/changes can be found in: 
 - Open Issues (https://github.com/temporalio/temporal/issues for server & current version tctl) 
 - Proposals repo https://github.com/temporalio/proposals
  
As for tctl specifically the change to update the printing mechanism of objects is proposed here https://github.com/temporalio/proposals/pull/31 (feedback is highly welcomed!) . I've also opened up the new tctl repo so now people can see the actual progress https://github.com/temporalio/tctl . This eventually should replace the tctl from temporal repo

Speaking of printing mechanism, the current stage of the proposal is implemented. In terms of code, here is a sample how workflow fields are picked and printed https://github.com/temporalio/tctl/blob/a400f112efa4724e841ae7e6f440bd4127b93884/cli/workflowCommands.go#L530

lmk if this helps to address your questions. Thx for looking into contributing
This is fixed in temporal/CLI https://github.com/temporalio/cli

title: tctl: adm namespace list issue
